text: Preheat your oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  In your large bowl, combine both your ground turkey and your ground beef. If they need to be broken down into smaller pieces do so now. Add the breadcrumbs, egg, paprika, cayenne pepper, Adobo seasoning salt, fresh ground pepper, garlic cloves, dried oregano, and habanero pepper sauce, into the bowl.  Use your hands and mix until all ingredients are well combined and thoroughly incorporated.  Grab your baking sheet, and shape the mixture into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet.  Place them in the oven for 18 minutes.  While your meatballs are in the oven, it's time to prepare the glaze!  In your large frying pan combine the light brown sugar, rice vinegar, and white cooking wine.  Stir the glaze over a medium fire for 5 minutes. Then turn it to low until the meatballs are done. Drain off the liquid from the meatballs once they are finished and add them to a frying pan.  Cover the frying pan and cook on each side for 5 minutes or until golden brown on medium fire. Occasionally pour some glaze over the meatballs. Remove from frying pan and serve.  You're done! Enjoy your meatballs hot!
